alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 06 at 5:59PM PST until January 07 at 2:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet expected. * WHERE...Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Strong rip currents and longshore currents hazardous to swimmers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf has diminished below High Surf Advisory criteria (above 7 feet) this evening, though surf will remain elevated at 5 to 7 feet through Saturday afternoon. Surf could remain elevated through much of the next week as more westerly swells move into Southern California.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.
